etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 巴(巴) (bā, "cling") = mouth making clinging or sticky sound -> trumpet sound
etymology.interpretation: The character 叭(bā) combines the semantic element of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") with the phonetic 巴(巴) (bā), suggesting a sound involving the mouth, reminiscent of a trumpet or similar instrument.

examples.chinese: 演奏会开始时(演奏會開始時)，小号发出清脆的叭声(小號發出清脆的叭聲)。
examples.pinyin: Yǎnzòu huì kāishǐ shí, xiǎohào fāchū qīngcuì de bā shēng.
examples.english: When the concert began, the trumpet produced a crisp 'bā' sound.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临时(夜幕降臨時)，远处传来叭的响声(叭的響聲)，犹如召唤记忆(猶如召喚記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Yèmù jiànglín shí, yuǎnchù chuán lái bā de xiǎngshēng, yóurú zhàohuàn jìyì.
examples.english: When night fell, a 'bā' sound echoed from afar, as if summoning memories.
